Name: Himanshu Bhatt
Title: small temple near shipra river
Review: its a small temple near shipra river where you can find extreme peace and silence. a nice place to visit for occassional visits.

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Founder of nath followers
Review: The place is a shrine of pir matsyendranath,who was the founder of nath form of worship of shivam, that's located on a hill top on the bank's of river shipra close to kale temple and the famous caves.

Name: Ajay KMehta
Title: Very Peaceful
Review: Simple un appointed place of one of the great yogis  and teachers of Yoga.He was the physical teacher of Sri Gorakhnath ji who is considered an incarnation of Shiva.Hopefuly devotees will take better care of this place.

Name: Footprints727663
Title: Famous Attraction
Review: I went to Pir Matsyendranath. It was constructed in remembrance of the greatest leaders of the Natha sect of Saivism-Matsyendranath, very much like all the other monuments. This is a famous attraction on the banks of River Shipra. It is great place to go.

Name: niya27
Title: Little far away
Review: This place is approximately 8-10 kilometers from ujjain. This place is worshipped by both Hindu and Muslim Religion people. None was there when I visited this place.

Name: Maneesh12345
Title: Samadi of Pir Matsyendranath
Review: If you wish to skip this place you can do that.Many people here visit in black dress who are  disciple of Guru Matsyendranath. I was sitting here for long and it was a other type of experience of my life. Really if you need an experience of paranormal then you must visit here.

Name: samsamal
Title: Samadhi of Matsyendranath
Review: Matsyendranath, the founder of Nath cult  and Guru of Gorakshnath took samadhi at this place on the outskirts of Ujjain.The samadhi is decorated with flowers.A must visit for mythology, legends lovers and also who believe in beliefs / faith and look forward to positives, life has to offer.Its believed that he mastered 84 mahasiddhis (supernatural powers).Very serene and calm place, hardly a visitor except a couple of Nath yogis who stay nearby. Muslims also revere the saint and hence also known as Pir Matsyendranath. It's on the same tour circuit as Bhatrihari caves and Garhkalika mandir.Parking space and a toilet is available.

Name: Manish B
Title: Tomb of Matsyendra Nath
Review: This Tomb of Matsyendra Nath who follow Nath sect. Near to Brathari caves and gar kalika temple at the bank of river Shipra. Matsyendranath ji was the master of Guru Gorakshnath who started Hath Yoga. One good place to visit.

Name: Shubham06
Title: Fine place if you have time
Review: People can go out for a stroll if you haven't visited. one of loads of religious places in the city of Ujjain.

Name: Apoorv Joshi
Title: samadhi
Review: this place will come between if you take tour of ujjain with any tour operator.if you are short in time then you can skip it otherwise good place to visit.

Name: npn2000
Title: Pir Matsyendranath
Review: Pir Matsyendranath is at outer part of ujjian and is worth to visit during Bhartihari caves and other temple on the way

Name: JAGDISH RAVAL
Title: Average Place
Review: One can skipp this from tourist list. The place is dedicated to Matsyendranath. He was first Nath of Nine Nath. Hindu and muslim both comes here for offering prayer so called Pir Matsyendranath.

Name: VivekRastogi
Title: Master of Guru Goraksnath
Review: This is the samadhi place of Pir Matsyendranth, Pir Matsyendranth mastered 84 mahasiddhies and he was the master of Guru Goraksnath. He has written and develop Hath Yoga. and started a school with Guru Goraksnath.Here I am getting peace of mind and getting some Paranormal experience. Here one can find sometimes many person wearing black cloths. They are the disciple of Guru Matsyendranath. I was sitting here for long and it was a other type of experience of my life. Really if you need an experience of paranormal then you must visit here. Few tips - 1. Don't drink and go.2. Pregnant ladies should avoid the place to visit.

Name: vinodkhedkar
Title: Samadhi
Review: Matsyendranatha or Machindranath was one of the eighty-four Mahasiddhas. He was the guru of Gorakshanath, with whom he founded the school of Hatha yoga.This place is very small but very serene place.Holy shrine.

Name: loki_knows
Title: small but nice
Review: This is a small temple situated near Bartruhari caves and Gadkalika temple. It is built in memory of Matsyendranath, the temple is flocked by both hindus and muslims.he Hindus and the Muslims of Ujjain equally revere at this attractive shrine on the banks of the Shipra, Pir Matsyendranath. When Excavations were conductedat this site some antiques, dating back to the 6th and 7th century BC were found. Though this shrine is not a marvel in terms of architecture, its simple white structure with a dome flanked by small minarets on four sides provides a serene appeal to the surroundings.Visit when you are near ujjain.
